Introduction to corporate finance.description: Financial statements and ratio analysis, financial forecasting and planning, estimating risk and return, efficient-market hypothesis (EMH), capital structure and cost of capital (WACC), dividend policy, raising finance.
Introduction to corporate finance.school: The Open University Business School, PG

Research methods for finance.description: Research methods in finance, time series, panel data, probability distributions, linear and multiple regression, binary regression models.
Research methods for finance.school: The Open University Business School, PG

Network Theory.description: Graph theory, small world phenomenon and distributions, probabilistic models (information flow), queuing systems and networks, markov chain and decision process, network optimisation and mathematical modeling, optimisation problems (convex, lagrangian, integer programming, heuristics, greedy algorithms).

Pattern recognition, neural networks, an.description: Classifier design and methods, discriminant functions, learning algorithms, neural networks (artifical, multilayer, feedforward), deep discriminative and generative neural networks, feature extraction, support vector machines, clustering.

Nature inspired learning algorithms.description: Analytical and numerical optimisation, random-based optimisation, binary genetic algorithms, continuous genetic algorithms, evolution strategies, ant colony optimisation, particle swarm optimisation, differential evolution.

Big Data technologies.description: Distributed software and database systems, MapReduce, OLTP/OLAP, Apache Spark, data streaming.

Security engineering.description: Low-level programming in C and x86 Assembly, application security, implementation errors and exploits, static and dynamic analysis, privilege management and access control.

Computer vision.description: Image formation (physics, geometry, human visual system), filtering and convolution, feature detection, grouping and segmentation, object categorization and recognition, MATLAB.

Agents and multi-agent systems.description: Intelligent and autonomous agents, BDI, reactive and hybrid agent architectures, auctions and negotiations.

Artificial Intelligence: reasoning and d.description: Knowledge representation, probabilistic reasoning (MDP), temporal probabilistic reasoning, sequential decision making, game theory, argumentation, machine learning.

Introducing statistics.description: Descriptive statistics, regression and surveys, hypothesis testing, association and estimation, experiments and clinical trials.

Configuring Linux Web Servers.description: Linux fundamentals, virtual machines, and PostgreSQL.

Mathematical methods.description: Linear algebra, multivariable calculus, vector fields, first and second-order ordinary differential equations, partial differential equations.

Software engineering.description: Software architecture, agile methods, design patterns, domain modeling and analysis (UML).

Data management and analysis.description: Databases and data architectures, real-world dataset analysis (Python, SQL, MapReduce) and visualization (matplotlib), individual research and report writing.

Web, mobile and cloud technologies.description: Web standards and protocols, distributed architectures (REST, SOAP), mobile frameworks (Java, Android), cloud infrastructure and operations (OpenStack).

Essential mathematics II.description: Number theory, geometric transformations, differential equations, combinatorics, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, mathematical language and proof.

Algorithms, data structures and computab.description: Search and sorting algorithms (Python), binary trees, mathematical notation (sets, functions, logic, and proof), computational complexity.

IT project and service management.description: Software quality, team working, project and service management techniques (ITIL).

Web technologies.description: Client-server architecture, content markup (HTML, CSS, XML), usability and security (HTTPS), client and server side implementation languages (JavaScript, PHP, SQL).

Object-oriented Java programming.description: Object-oriented concepts and principles with Java.

Essential mathematics I.description: Trigonometric functions, vectors and matrices, differentiation and integration, sequences, complex numbers.

Data Analysis: Take it to the MAX().description: Spreadsheet techniques and best practices (PivotTables, VLOOKUPS, what-if analyses, graphs).

Introduction to Python for Data Science.description: Introduction to data analysis with Python (Numpy, Matplotlib, Pandas).

My digital life.description: Introduction to undergraduate-level computing and information technology.

Discovering mathematics.description: Introduction to undergraduate-level mathematics and statistics.

Intro to Programming.description: Introduction to programming with  HTML, CSS, and Python.

Intro to HTML and CSS.description: Web development fundamentals, best practices, and professional problem-solving techniques using Developer Tools.

Introduction to Programming and Thinking.description: Introduction to programming concepts and ideas.

Spanish: Beginner Course I.description: Introduction to Spanish language and culture.

Evolution of Life.description: Introduction to evolutionary biology, ecology, and geology.
